title: TC001-Homepage Load and Content Verification
description: Verify that the homepage loads successfully displaying the hero section and services grid with correct content and responsive layout.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Verify the page layout adjusts correctly across desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Verify the responsive layout on tablet and mobile screen sizes
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Simulate tablet screen size and verify layout adjustments for hero section and services grid
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Simulate mobile screen size and verify layout adjustments for hero section and services grid
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=INDIA\'S MOST TRUSTED').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Divine Puja Services').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Griha Pravesh Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Satyanarayan Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Rudrabhishek Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Marriage / Vivah Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Lakshmi Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Office Opening Puja').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Booking Form Validation and Submission Success
description: Check that the booking form enforces required fields, correct formats, and processes submissions successfully via the API route.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the 'Book Now' button to navigate to the puja service booking form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Book Now' button in the header to go to the booking form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/header/nav/div/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Booking Failed: Invalid API Response').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The booking form did not enforce required fields, correct formats, or process submissions successfully via the API route as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click the 'Book Now' button to navigate to the booking form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Book Now' button to navigate to the booking form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/section/div[3]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try clicking the 'Book Now' link (index 9) in the header navigation to see if it leads to the booking form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Book Now' link in the header navigation to try to access the booking form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/header/nav/div/div/a[8]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Booking Successful! Your reservation is confirmed.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Booking form validation did not work as expected. Invalid inputs such as missing required fields, incorrect email formats, or invalid phone numbers were not properly rejected, and appropriate error messages were not displayed.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC005-API Route Error Handling for Booking Form Submission
description: Test the booking API route returns appropriate error responses when invalid or incomplete data is submitted.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Submit booking data with missing required fields via API endpoint to test error response.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/api/booking', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Look for documentation or clues on the homepage or other pages about the correct booking API endpoint or how to submit booking data.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Click on 'Book Now' button to access booking form or booking page to find correct API endpoint or test booking submission.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Book Now' button on homepage
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/section/div[3]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Booking Successful! Your reservation is confirmed.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Booking API route did not return appropriate error responses for invalid or incomplete data submission as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC006-Breadcrumb Navigation Correctness
description: Ensure breadcrumb navigation accurately reflects the hierarchical path for any page and links navigate correctly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to a puja service page to check breadcrumb navigation.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Try to navigate to a puja service page or informative page using any available navigation or links to test breadcrumb navigation.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Try to navigate to a puja service page or informative page by opening a new tab or using any other method to find pages with breadcrumb navigation.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/puja-services', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to an informative page or homepage to find breadcrumb navigation or links to test.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/informative', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Return to homepage or try another known page with expected breadcrumb navigation to test.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Click on 'Puja Services' link in the top navigation to navigate to a puja service page and check breadcrumb navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Puja Services' link in the top navigation menu
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/header/nav/div/a/div/img').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Scroll down to find breadcrumb navigation or links to test breadcrumb accuracy and navigation.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Click on 'Book This Puja' link for 'Griha Pravesh Puja' to navigate to its detail page and check breadcrumb navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Book This Puja' link for 'Griha Pravesh Puja' service
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/section[2]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click breadcrumb links 'Home' and 'Puja Services' one by one to verify navigation to parent pages.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Home' breadcrumb link to navigate to homepage
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/nav/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Navigate back to Griha Pravesh Puja detail page and click 'Puja Services' breadcrumb link to verify navigation to parent page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Puja Services' link in top navigation to go back to Puja Services page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/header/nav/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Book This Puja' link for 'Griha Pravesh Puja' to go to detail page again
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/section[2]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on a puja service card's 'Book Now' button to navigate to its detail page and verify breadcrumb navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Book Now' button for Satyanarayan Vrat Udyapan puja service
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/main/section[2]/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/a/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try clicking the 'Puja Services' breadcrumb link with index 3 instead, as it also appears to be the same link in the breadcrumb navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Puja Services' breadcrumb link alternative to verify navigation
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/header/nav/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Home').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Puja Services').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
